location: The attempted bombing took place in Federation Park on the Drayton Connection Road, near Vale View south of Toowoomba, Queensland, Australia.
summary: 04/21/2008: On Monday, a 30 mm pipe bomb rigged with external batteries and a mobile phone was detonated by the police bomb squad unit after it was found by council workers in Federation Park on the Drayton Connection Road, near Vale View south of Toowoomba, Queensland, Australia. No claim of responsibility was made for the attempted bombing, however on 04/22/2008 on Tuesday, executed a search warrant at a home in Kent Street at Oakey and allegedly found evidence of a home-made explosive device. A 21-year-old man was arrested and charged with one count of attempting to damage property by explosives.
targsubtype1_txt: Public Area (garden, parking lot, garage, beach, public building, camp)
motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown or was not reported.
weapdetail: A mobile phone-triggered, battery-powered, 30 mm pipe was used in the attack.
scite1: News.com.au, Police Destroy Pipe Bomb Found at Toowoomba Park"
column111: 12/08/2008: On Monday, a Holden Rodeo ute vehicle carrying a 220-liter fuel tank was backed into the Joondalup police station and set aflame. The attack damaged two offices, one of which was the inspector's District Office. No casualties were reported.
column157: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column190: A fuel tank was set ablaze in the attack.
column193: ABC, Police Seeking Man Over Firebombings"
column202: Warwick district, Joondalup Warwick Police station
column203: 12/10/2008: On Wednesday morning, at 0235, two private vehicles belonging to Warwick police officers were firebombed in Joondalup, Western Australia, Oceania, Australia.

column282: A firebomb was used in the attack
column285: Watoday, Thomson, Chris, and Chalpat Sonti, Man Charged Over Joondalup Police Station Bombing"
column294: The explosive was placed on the hood of a car on Market Street at Condell Park, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.
column295: 10/08/2009: On Thursday night at 0100, in Market Street in Condell park, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia, an improvised explosive device placed on the hood of a car detonated, smashing the windows of two townhouses and destroying the vehicle. Investigator Mark Smith says it is not clear if the device was intended for the vehicle or the townhouses 10-15 meters away. No group claimed responsibility.
column316: A civilian vehicle was targeted in the attack.
column341: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column374: An improvised explosive device placed  on the hood of a car was used in the attack.

location: The attack took place at a mosque in Queens Park, Perth.
summary: 02/04/2010: On Thursday night, in Queens Park, Perth, Western Australia, Australia, armed assailants fired upon a mosque, damaging the mosque but causing no casualties. No group claimed responsibility, although authorities believed Combat 18 was responsible.
motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
weapdetail: Unknown firearms were used in the attack.
scite1: National Counterterrorism Center, One Mosque Damaged in Armed Attack by Suspected Combat 18 in Perth"

location: The incident occurred in the West Melbourne area of the city.
summary: 09/02/2013: Assailants set fire to Gran Turismo Autos, a luxury car showroom, in West Melbourne area, Melbourne city, Victoria state, Australia. The fire damaged several vehicles, but did not cause any casualties. The Felicity Ann Ryder Cell of the Informal Anarchist Federation claimed responsibility for the attack in a post online; however, police denied that the group was involved in the incident.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Authorities suspected that the fire may have been accidentally started by a lit cigarette.
scite1: Anarchists claim responsibility for fire at luxury West Melbourne car dealership"

summary: 02/24/2014: Assailants threw three homemade incendiary devices at the Logan Police District Headquarters in Logan City, southeast Queensland state, Australia. There were no casualties in the incident; however, one police vehicle suffered fire damage. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anarchists.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the attack comes after an incident of police brutality which left an indigenous woman partly blind.
weapdetail: Three Molotov cocktails were used in the attack.
scite1: The Logan Police District Headquarters at Logan Central has been attacked with three homemade firebombs hurled"

location: The incident occurred in the Woollahra neighborhood of the city.
summary: 05/18/2014: Assailants set fire to two vehicles on Queen street in Woollahra neighborhood, Sydney city, New South Wales state, Australia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks carried out by the Informal Anarchist Federation in Woollahra neighborhood on May 18, 2014. The Informal Anarchist Federation claimed responsibility for the incident, stating that the attack was carried out in retaliation to injustice.
motive: The Informal Anarchist Federation claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to injustice.
scite1: Luxury cars destroyed in random attacks in Woollahra"

location: The incident occurred in the Woolahra neighborhood of the city.

This was one of two coordinated attacks carried out by the same group in Woolahra neighborhood on May 18, 2014. The Informal Anarchist Federation claimed responsibility for the incident.
scite1: Luxury cars destroyed in random attacks in Woollahra"

summary: 08/12/2014: Assailants set a private vehicle on fire that belonged to an Australian Federal Police (AFP) officer outside the police station in Beechworth town, Victoria state, Australia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
weapdetail: Gasoline was used in the attack.
scite1: The ugly secret of a town's fire"

summary: 09/23/2014: An assailant stabbed two police officers in Melbourne city, Victoria state, Australia. Authorities shot and killed the assailant and the two police officers were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an individual, identified as Abdul Numan Haider.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources posited that prior to the attack the assailant, Abdul Numan Haider, had posted a message on Facebook, which criticized the Australian Federal Police (AFP) and alleged that they were at war with Islam.
scite1: ISIS Lieutenant Emerges From Australian Red-Light District"

location: The incident occurred in the Greenacre neighborhood
summary: 11/03/2014: Assailants opened fire on Rasoul Al-Musawi outside of an Islamic prayer center in Bankstown area, New South Wales state, Australia. Musawi, a Shia religious leader, was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, people chanting pro-Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) statements drove by the center just before the shooting.
weapdetail: Pellets were used in the attack.
scite1: Religious leader shot outside Islamic centre in Greenacre following threats"

summary: 12/02/2014: Assailants set fire to the Oberon NSW Slaughterhouse in Oberon town, New South Wales state, Australia. There were no reported casualties in the attack; however, the building was damaged in the attack. The Animal Liberation Front (ALF) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for profiting from animal abuse.
motive: The Animal Liberation Front (ALF) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation to the profiting from animal abuse.
scite1: Police investigate Oberon Abattoir fire"

location: The incident occurred in the Martin Place neighborhood
summary: 12/15/2014: An assailant, Mon Haron Monis, took 18 people hostage in the Lindt Chocolate cafe in Sydney city, New South Wales state, Australia. Five hostages were able to escape during standoff. After 16 hours, police stormed the cafe and freed the living hostages. In total, Monis and two hostages were killed and four other hostages were wounded in the attack and siege. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
weapdetail: A sawed-off shotgun was used in the attack.
addnotes: During the standoff, Monis had declared allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
scite1: Lone   gunman"
scite2: two hostages killed in Sydney cafe siege: police

motive: Jihadi-Inspired extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Sunnis were the only Muslims."" Sources also noted that the assailants carried out the attack in order to intimidate members of the Shia Muslim community and that the words ""Islamic State"" were spray-painted on the building.""

location: The incident occurred on Bay street.
summary: 06/05/2017: An assailants took a sex worker hostage at the Buckingham Serviced Apartments on Bay Street in Brighton, Victoria, Australia. At least two people, including the assailant, were killed and three Victoria Police officers were injured in the incident. The hostage was released a few hours later. Yacqub Khayre claimed responsibility and stated that he carried out the attack on behalf of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and Al-Qaida.
motive: An unaffiliated individual, identified as Yacqub Khayre, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack on behalf of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and Al-Qaida.
addnotes: The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, Khayre's connection to ISIL could not be confirmed. Furthermore, Khayre had previous been linked to Al-Shabaab. Casualty numbers conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority reliable estimates are reported here.
scite1: Australia police regard Melbourne attack as 'act of terrorism'"

summary: 07/15/2017: Assailants attempted to smuggle luggage containing two explosive devices onto an airplane at Sydney Airport in Sydney, Australia. After the luggage was refused by the airline for being overweight, the assailants left the airport and subsequently dismantled the devices. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated that the attempted attack was coordinated by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)
weapdetail: Two explosive devices, including one hidden inside a meat grinder and another inside a Barbie doll, planted inside luggage were used in the attack.
scite1: Australian terror plan to hide plane bomb in Barbie revealed"

location: The incident occurred in the Callistemon Rise are of the Mill Park neighborhood.
summary: 02/09/2018: An assailant stabbed Roger Singaravelu at his residence in Mill Park neighborhood, Melbourne, Australia. Singaravelu, who had served as a homestay host to the assailant, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested and charged Momena Shoma in connection with the attack and stated that Shoma was inspired by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the attack was inspired by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). Sources also noted that the assailant's sister admitted to being a member of the Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB).
weapdetail: A knife was used in the attack.
scite1: Sister of Bangladeshi student accused of Melbourne stabbing arrested in Dhaka; Police say Asmaul Husna"
scite3: attacked officers with a knife when they tried to question her

scite1: Arsonists suspected"

summary: 11/09/2018: An assailant exited his car, which was loaded with gas cylinders that caught fire, and proceeded to stab civilians in central Melbourne, Australia. One civilian was killed and two others were injured in the attack before the assailant was shot and killed by police. Sources noted that the assailant, Hassan Khalif Shire Ali, had his passport revoked in 2015 because authorities believed he was planning to travel to Syria in order to join the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that Hassan Khalif Shire Ali's passport was cancelled in 2015 because authorities believed he was planning to travel to Syria in order to join the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
weapdetail: A pickup truck filled with gas cylinders and a knife were used in the attack.
addnotes: The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)'s Amaq News Agency claimed that Hassan Khalif Shire Ali was one of Islamic State fighters;"" however"
scite1: there was no known connection between Ali and ISIL found. The victims included restaurant owner Sisto Malaspina.","Police Say Treating Melbourne Stabbing As A Terror Attack
